description.narrative:
Theory of Change: - The project falls under the thematic area on greater responsibility in finance for development. Through our work, Oxfam Novib and SOMO aim to achieve that more women, youth and other citizens benefit from higher quality and quantity of financefor development, an enhanced fiscal system and a sustainable and inclusive financial and corporate sector, tackling extreme inequality.
Within this Theory of Change, this project in Vietnam has set the following impact and objective: - The project's desired impact: Reduce inequality and improve quality of life of women and marginalized groups in Vietnam as a result of equitable and accountable fiscal policies and practices - The project's long-term outcome: At least one million people frommarginalized groups (women, the poor and near- poor, ethnic minorities) in Vietnam benefit socially and economically from fairer taxation, accountable public services financing (especially health services).
In general terms a description of the strategies that we apply to achieve our long term outcome: - Strengthened CSOs: Capacity building and Civil society space - Policy change (Government and Private sector): research, lobby activities - Increased citizen's voice - "Stronger and wider alliances"is also a part of the Oxfam country strategy in Vietnam.It is a cross-cutting theme in this proposal, through capacity building for multi-stakeholder coalitions, linkages to receptive government policy-makers and business actors, and in strengthening citizen voice through media and other forms of influencing.
To achieve this long-term outcome in Vietnam, Oxfam works together with the following partners: - Quang Binh People's Council in Quang Binhprovince, Vietnam. - Quang Tri People's Council in Quang Tri province, Vietnam. - Institute for Development and Community Health - LIGHT - Wake It Up Technology Joint Stock Limited - Real - Time Analytics Company Limited (RTA)

participating-org.narrative: In Vietnam , Oxfam is one of the leading international, non -governmental organisation. Since 1955, Oxfam is active in Vietnam withhumanitarian interventions and started development work in the late 1980's. Today, Oxfam works in 26 provinces with people, governments and civil society to promote equality and well-being through social and economic change.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
